edits.text:
Param(
    [string]$ChatsDir = "documentation/chats",
    [string]$OutputFile = "documentation/generative-ai.md"
)

# Ensure paths are relative to repository root
$repoRoot = Split-Path -Parent $PSCommandPath
Push-Location $repoRoot | Out-Null
try {
    if (-not (Test-Path $ChatsDir)) {
        throw "Chats directory not found: $ChatsDir"
    }

    $chatFiles = Get-ChildItem -Path $ChatsDir -Filter 'chat*.json' -File |
        Sort-Object { [int]($_.BaseName -replace '[^0-9]', '') }

    if (-not $chatFiles) {
        throw "No chat JSON files found in $ChatsDir"
    }

    # Start fresh output (use ASCII hyphen to avoid encoding issues in some shells)
    "# Generative AI - All Conversations`r`n" | Out-File -FilePath $OutputFile -Encoding utf8

    $convIndex = 1
    foreach ($file in $chatFiles) {
        $jsonRaw = Get-Content -LiteralPath $file.FullName -Raw -Encoding UTF8
        $chat = $jsonRaw | ConvertFrom-Json

    $model = $chat.responderUsername
    "`r`n## Conversation $convIndex`r`n`r`nDate: `r`n`r`nModel: $model`r`n" | Out-File -FilePath $OutputFile -Append -Encoding utf8

        $turnIndex = 1
        foreach ($req in $chat.requests) {
            # Prompt (verbatim)
            $promptText = $req.message.text
            "`r`nPrompt (Turn $turnIndex):`r`n" | Out-File -FilePath $OutputFile -Append -Encoding utf8
            @"
```
$promptText
```
"@ | Out-File -FilePath $OutputFile -Append -Encoding utf8

            # Response (verbatim, concatenated in order of segments without injection)
            $respSegments = @()
            if ($req.response) {
                foreach ($r in $req.response) {
                    if ($null -ne $r.PSObject.Properties['value']) {
                        $respSegments += [string]$r.value
                    }
                }
            }
            $respText = ($respSegments -join '')
            "`r`nAI response (Turn $turnIndex):`r`n" | Out-File -FilePath $OutputFile -Append -Encoding utf8
            @"
```
$respText
```
"@ | Out-File -FilePath $OutputFile -Append -Encoding utf8

            $turnIndex++
        }

        # Notes section per conversation
    "`r`nNotes (optional):`r`n`r`n---" | Out-File -FilePath $OutputFile -Append -Encoding utf8
        $convIndex++
    }

    # Append reflection and checklist templates
    @"

## Reflection - How AI helped and what I learned

Write a short reflection addressing the following:

- Which tasks you used AI for (e.g., creating docs, generating code snippets, debugging, writing commands).
- How AI improved your workflow or saved time.
- Any limitations or inaccuracies you noticed and how you verified/fixed them.
- Key learnings from using AI for this milestone.

Minimum 200 words. Missing this reflection = 0 points.

---

## Checklist (student use)

- [ ] All prompts pasted (verbatim)
- [ ] All responses pasted (verbatim)
- [ ] Reflection written (>=200 words)
- [ ] File included in milestone submission

---

## Instructor notes

(Leave this empty for the grader or add any extra context.)
"@ | Out-File -FilePath $OutputFile -Append -Encoding utf8
}
finally {
    Pop-Location | Out-Null
}

Param(
    [string]$ChatsDir = "documentation/chats",
    [string]$OutputFile = "documentation/generative-ai.md"
)

# Resolve repository root as the parent of the scripts directory
$scriptDir = Split-Path -Parent $PSCommandPath
$repoRoot = Split-Path -Parent $scriptDir
Push-Location $repoRoot | Out-Null
try {
    # Normalize and resolve paths
    if (-not [System.IO.Path]::IsPathRooted($ChatsDir)) { $ChatsDir = Join-Path -Path $repoRoot -ChildPath $ChatsDir }
    if (-not [System.IO.Path]::IsPathRooted($OutputFile)) { $OutputFile = Join-Path -Path $repoRoot -ChildPath $OutputFile }

    if (-not (Test-Path -LiteralPath $ChatsDir -PathType Container)) {
        throw "Chats directory not found: $ChatsDir"
    }

    $chatFiles = Get-ChildItem -Path $ChatsDir -Filter 'chat*.json' -File |
        Sort-Object { [int]($_.BaseName -replace '[^0-9]', '') }

    if (-not $chatFiles) {
        throw "No chat JSON files found in $ChatsDir"
    }

    # Start fresh output (use ASCII hyphen to avoid encoding issues in some shells)
    "# Generative AI - All Conversations`r`n" | Out-File -FilePath $OutputFile -Encoding utf8

    $convIndex = 1
    foreach ($file in $chatFiles) {
        $jsonRaw = Get-Content -LiteralPath $file.FullName -Raw -Encoding UTF8
        $chat = $jsonRaw | ConvertFrom-Json

    $model = $chat.responderUsername
    "`r`n## Conversation $convIndex`r`n`r`nDate: `r`n`r`nModel: $model`r`n" | Out-File -FilePath $OutputFile -Append -Encoding utf8

        $turnIndex = 1
        foreach ($req in $chat.requests) {
            # Prompt (verbatim)
            $promptText = $req.message.text
            "`r`nPrompt (Turn $turnIndex):`r`n" | Out-File -FilePath $OutputFile -Append -Encoding utf8
            @"
```
$promptText
```
"@ | Out-File -FilePath $OutputFile -Append -Encoding utf8

            # Response (verbatim, concatenated in order of segments without injection)
            $respSegments = @()
            if ($req.response) {
                foreach ($r in $req.response) {
                    if ($null -ne $r.PSObject.Properties['value']) {
                        $respSegments += [string]$r.value
                    }
                }
            }
            $respText = ($respSegments -join '')
            "`r`nAI response (Turn $turnIndex):`r`n" | Out-File -FilePath $OutputFile -Append -Encoding utf8
            @"
```
$respText
```
"@ | Out-File -FilePath $OutputFile -Append -Encoding utf8

            $turnIndex++
        }

        # Notes section per conversation
    "`r`nNotes (optional):`r`n`r`n---" | Out-File -FilePath $OutputFile -Append -Encoding utf8
        $convIndex++
    }

    # Append reflection and checklist templates
    @"

## Reflection - How AI helped and what I learned

Write a short reflection addressing the following:

- Which tasks you used AI for (e.g., creating docs, generating code snippets, debugging, writing commands).
- How AI improved your workflow or saved time.
- Any limitations or inaccuracies you noticed and how you verified/fixed them.
- Key learnings from using AI for this milestone.

Minimum 200 words. Missing this reflection = 0 points.

---

- [ ] All prompts pasted (verbatim)
- [ ] All responses pasted (verbatim)
- [ ] Reflection written (>=200 words)
- [ ] File included in milestone submission

---

## Instructor notes

(Leave this empty for the grader or add any extra context.)
"@ | Out-File -FilePath $OutputFile -Append -Encoding utf8
}
finally {
    Pop-Location | Out-Null
}

You're right to insist on verbatim contentâ€”I've rebuilt the Markdown directly from the JSON so every prompt and every AI response is pasted exactly as stored, with no edits.

What I did
- Added a reliable exporter: Created

to read all documentation/chats/chat*.json and regenerate documentation/generative-ai.md.
- Regenerated the Markdown: Ran the script so the file now contains verbatim prompts and responses for all turns across conversations 1 through 21.
- Spot-checked for fidelity: Verified multiple distinctive strings appear exactly as in the JSON (e.g., the HAProxy ALERT lines, â€œGet the cert from the enviroment vars DOMAINâ€, lego â€œ!!!! HEADS UP !!!!â€, and the chat21 â€œIâ€™ll (1) create a short todo listâ€¦â€ message). Also confirmed all conversation headers 1â€“21 are present.

What you can run locally
- To re-generate the file anytime:
```powershell
powershell -NoProfile -ExecutionPolicy Bypass -File "scripts/Export-ChatsToMarkdown.ps1"
```

Notes and guarantees
- The exporter wraps each prompt and response in its own fenced code block so thereâ€™s zero formatting interference and the text remains exact.
- It concatenates all response segments for each turn in order, without altering text or whitespace.
- Dates are left blank because theyâ€™re not present in the JSON; model is taken from responderUsername.
- The resulting file begins with â€œ# Generative AI - All Conversationsâ€ and then lists â€œ## Conversation 1 â€¦ ## Conversation 21â€ in numerical order.

If you want, I can:
- Add timestamps if any are present elsewhere in the JSON schema.
- Include requester and source file context per turn (e.g., variableData) as separate sections.
- Split output into one file per conversation to make grading easier.

Would you like me to push a commit or adjust the formatting (headings only) while keeping the transcript text strictly verbatim?

toolCalls.name: create_file
toolCalls.arguments:
{"filePath":"c:\Users\David\OneDrive - Thomas More\Semester 3\Linux Web Services\git\scripts\Export-ChatsToMarkdown.ps1","content":"Param(
    [string]$ChatsDir = "documentation/chats",
    [string]$OutputFile = "documentation/generative-ai.md"
)

# Ensure paths are relative to repository root
$repoRoot = Split-Path -Parent $PSCommandPath
Push-Location $repoRoot | Out-Null
try {
    if (-not (Test-Path $ChatsDir)) {
        throw "Chats directory not found: $ChatsDir"
    }

    $chatFiles = Get-ChildItem -Path $ChatsDir -Filter 'chat*.json' -File |
        Sort-Object { [int]($_.BaseName -replace '[^0-9]', '') }

    if (-not $chatFiles) {
        throw "No chat JSON files found in $ChatsDir"
    }

    # Start fresh output
    "# Generative AI â€” All Conversations`r`n" | Out-File -FilePath $OutputFile -Encoding utf8

    $convIndex = 1
    foreach ($file in $chatFiles) {
        $jsonRaw = Get-Content -LiteralPath $file.FullName -Raw -Encoding UTF8
        $chat = $jsonRaw | ConvertFrom-Json

        $model = $chat.responderUsername
        "`r`n## Conversation $convIndex`r`n`r`nDate: `r`n`r`nModel: $model`r`n" | Out-File -FilePath $OutputFile -Append -Encoding utf8

        $turnIndex = 1
        foreach ($req in $chat.requests) {
            # Prompt (verbatim)
            $promptText = $req.message.text
            "`r`nPrompt (Turn $turnIndex):`r`n" | Out-File -FilePath $OutputFile -Append -Encoding utf8
            @"
```
$promptText
```
"@ | Out-File -FilePath $OutputFile -Append -Encoding utf8

            # Response (verbatim, concatenated in order of segments without injection)
            $respSegments = @()
            if ($req.response) {
                foreach ($r in $req.response) {
                    if ($null -ne $r.PSObject.Properties['value']) {
                        $respSegments += [string]$r.value
                    }
                }
            }
            $respText = ($respSegments -join '')
            "`r`nAI response (Turn $turnIndex):`r`n" | Out-File -FilePath $OutputFile -Append -Encoding utf8
            @"
```
$respText
```
"@ | Out-File -FilePath $OutputFile -Append -Encoding utf8

            $turnIndex++
        }

        # Notes section per conversation
        "`r`nNotes (optional):`r`n`r`n---" | Out-File -FilePath $OutputFile -Append -Encoding utf8
        $convIndex++
    }

    # Append reflection and checklist templates
    @"

## Reflection â€” How AI helped and what I learned

Write a short reflection addressing the following:

- Which tasks you used AI for (e.g., creating docs, generating code snippets, debugging, writing commands).
- How AI improved your workflow or saved time.
- Any limitations or inaccuracies you noticed and how you verified/fixed them.
- Key learnings from using AI for this milestone.

Minimum 200 words. Missing this reflection = 0 points.

---

## Checklist (student use)

- [ ] All prompts pasted (verbatim)
- [ ] All responses pasted (verbatim)
- [ ] Reflection written (>=200 words)
- [ ] File included in milestone submission

---

## Instructor notes

(Leave this empty for the grader or add any extra context.)
"@ | Out-File -FilePath $OutputFile -Append -Encoding utf8
}
finally {
    Pop-Location | Out-Null
}
"}

You're right to insist on verbatim contentâ€”I've rebuilt the Markdown directly from the JSON so every prompt and every AI response is pasted exactly as stored, with no edits.

What I did
- Added a reliable exporter: Created scripts/Export-ChatsToMarkdown.ps1 to read all documentation/chats/chat*.json and regenerate documentation/generative-ai.md.
- Regenerated the Markdown: Ran the script so the file now contains verbatim prompts and responses for all turns across conversations 1 through 21.
- Spot-checked for fidelity: Verified multiple distinctive strings appear exactly as in the JSON (e.g., the HAProxy ALERT lines, â€œGet the cert from the enviroment vars DOMAINâ€, lego â€œ!!!! HEADS UP !!!!â€, and the chat21 â€œIâ€™ll (1) create a short todo listâ€¦â€ message). Also confirmed all conversation headers 1â€“21 are present.

What you can run locally
- To re-generate the file anytime:
```powershell
powershell -NoProfile -ExecutionPolicy Bypass -File "scripts/Export-ChatsToMarkdown.ps1"
```

Notes and guarantees
- The exporter wraps each prompt and response in its own fenced code block so thereâ€™s zero formatting interference and the text remains exact.
- It concatenates all response segments for each turn in order, without altering text or whitespace.
- Dates are left blank because theyâ€™re not present in the JSON; model is taken from responderUsername.
- The resulting file begins with â€œ# Generative AI - All Conversationsâ€ and then lists â€œ## Conversation 1 â€¦ ## Conversation 21â€ in numerical order.

If you want, I can:
- Add timestamps if any are present elsewhere in the JSON schema.
- Include requester and source file context per turn (e.g., variableData) as separate sections.
- Split output into one file per conversation to make grading easier.

Would you like me to push a commit or adjust the formatting (headings only) while keeping the transcript text strictly verbatim?

I'll update the Dockerfile to reduce image size, reduce layers, use --no-install-recommends, use COPY --chown to avoid extra chown, make the start script more robust (use php-fpm in daemon mode and run apache in foreground as non-root), and add a small HEALTHCHECK. I'll apply the patch to `Milestone 1/webserver/Dockerfile`. Expected outcome: smaller, cleaner image and clearer runtime script.
Applying the patch now. Running the patch again with the absolute Windows-style path so the file is found and updated.
I'll make a tiny fix: call the correct php-fpm binary name (php${PHP_VERSION}-fpm) in the start script so it matches Ubuntu service names. Applying one small patch to the Dockerfile.
Why: I'll make the start script safer by writing environment settings to a single docker-specific PHP-FPM pool file (overwriting instead of appending) to avoid duplicate entries on restarts.
What I'll run: update the Dockerfile's /start.sh content to create/overwrite /etc/php/${PHP_VERSION}/fpm/pool.d/docker-env.conf.
Expected outcome: env vars are injected cleanly without repeated appends on each container start.
- use COPY --chown to avoid extra chown layer
- configure Apache to run as non-root user
- create a safer /start.sh that writes env vars into a separate pool file and starts php-fpm and Apache properly

Next: run a quick lint/build test? I can't build Docker images here, but I can run a lightweight grep to ensure the Dockerfile contains the expected changes. I'll show the diffs summary and suggest next steps for the user to build and test locally.
I updated and optimized your `Milestone 1/webserver/Dockerfile`. Below is a concise summary of what I changed, why, and how to test/build locally.
- Combined apt steps and used --no-install-recommends to reduce image size.
- Added `ARG PHP_VERSION=8.3` and used it to keep PHP version usage consistent and easy to change.
- Replaced repeated chown runs by using `COPY --chown=apacheuser:www-data` to avoid an extra layer.
- Created a non-root `apacheuser` and configured Apache to run as that user (via `/etc/apache2/envvars` changes).
- Simplified and hardened the start script:
- Writes environment variables into a single `/etc/php/<ver>/fpm/pool.d/docker-env.conf` (overwrites instead of appending to prevent duplicate entries on restarts).
- Starts PHP-FPM daemon (`php<ver>-fpm -D`) and then Apache in the foreground as `apacheuser`.
- Added `HEALTHCHECK` to ensure basic service liveness (curl to /).
- Minor housekeeping: removed apt lists and cleared default `/var/www/html/*` during build to keep the image smaller.
